page.title: 06FARMING, DOWNS EDINGTON (1)
page.content: The major part of the high ground belongs to the Ministry of Defence. Some of this land was acquired as far back as the Boer War for the purposes of army training. Tenants may crop Schedule I land as they wish; the army gives three months notice of using it for training. Schedule 3 land is rented much more cheaply; it has been cropped in ten acre blocks, alternate three year cereal, three year grass; but from l986 Schedule 3 tenants will only be allowed to grow grass as more use is being made of the land by the army. Stoke Hill farm has a thousand acres, mostly in this block. It is cropped with winter barley, wheat and oilseed rape. There is no livestock. The farm manager is the only person living on the Downs in this area.
